title: Quiz 1 - Mix Data Interpretation
instruction: Directions (46-50): The pie chart given below shows the percentage distribution of the production of various models of a car manufacturing company in 2007 and 2008. The total production in 2007 was 35 lakh cars and in 2008 the production was 44 lakh. Study the chart and answer the following questions.

quiz.text: If out of total marks Gaurav scored 111.5 marks and Veer scored 97 marks then marks of Veer in G.A. subject is how much more than the marks of Gaurav in Computer subject ?
options: 5
10
15
20
None of these

quiz.text: The Marks of Vikas out of total marks is approximately what percent more/less than the total marks obtained by Neeraj in all of the subjects if Vikas scored  more marks in Reasoning than what he scored in Quant subject and Neeraj scored  more marks in Quant than what he scored in Reasoning subject?
options: 0.4%
0.6%
0.2%
1%
1.2%

quiz.text: If the ratio of the marks of Gaurav in Computer and the marks of Mohit in English is 1 : 3 and marks of Gaurav in Computer subject is 12 marks less than the marks of Mohit in English subject then find the difference between the total marks obtained by all of them in English and total marks obtained by all of them in Computer ?
options: 71.25
68.5
65
66.25
67.5

quiz.text: Marks obtained by Neeraj in all of subjects except Quant is what percent of the total marks obtained by Veer in all of the subject except G.A. subject ? (Rounded off to two decimal points)
options: 96.65%
98.79%
99.25%
97.98%
100.28%

quiz.text: If the cut-off to pass the exam is 55% then how much minimum marks (in percentage) Vikas have to obtain in reasoning subject so that he can clear the cut-off marks ?
options: None of these

quiz.text: If the income of Aman in June is Rs. 45000 and his income in march is  more than his income in June, then find the percentage increase/decrease in the salary of Amit in June as compared to that in March?
options: 75%
60%
50%
80%
None of these

quiz.text: If the ratio of Aman’s saving to that of Amit’s saving in July is 4 : 3 and Aman’s saving in July is Rs. 40,000, then expenditure of Amit in July is how much % less than Aman’s expenditure in the same month ?
options: 30%
20%
35%
50%
None of these

quiz.text: If total salary of both the friends is equal in January and May then the total salary of Aman in these two months is what % of Amit’s salary in these two months ?(Calculate up to two decimal points)
options: 33.33%
66.66%
77.77%
37.5%
None of these

quiz.text: Aman spends rd of his salary in February on rent and  on travel, what is the ratio of remaining amount of his salary to the total salary of both the friends in the same month ?
options: 12 : 37
13 : 15
51 : 37
5 : 19
None of these

quiz.text: If the ratio of Aman’s salary to that of Amit in August is 1.5, and Amit’s salary in August rose by 20% as compared to his salary in July, then find the % increase in the salary of Aman in August as compared to July ? (Calculate up to two decimal points)
options: 26.74%
38.46%
30.51%
40.14%
None of these

quiz.text: The total no. of science student in 2004 was 900 and that of commerce students in 2007 was 700. Find the diff b/w the total number of students in these two years.
options: 350
250
275
400
325

quiz.text: The average percentage of arts students is approximately how many times the average percentage of commerce students?
options: 3
1.5
2.15
2
1.16

quiz.text: From 2005 to 2006, there was increment of 20% in total no. of students. If no. of science student in 2006 was 600 then find the total no. of students in arts stream in 2005.
options: 900
1000
950
800
700

quiz.text: If number of students in arts stream in 2003 was 800. Then find the average number of students in science & Commerce stream in 2003.
options: 950
1050
800
1200
1000

quiz.text: In 2004, there were 300 students in the science stream then find the ratio of no. of students in commerce and arts in that year.
options: 2 : 3
3 : 5
5 : 6
6 : 5
3 : 2

quiz.text: What percentage of male visitors went Delhi?
What is difference between no. of visitors, who went Chennai and Mumbai together and no. of female visitors who went Jaipur and Agra together?

quiz.text: Number of visitors in museum B in 2015 is approximately what percent of sum of number in visitors of museum A in 2012 and that of museum B in 2016?

52%

53100
60500
63000
None of these

quiz.text: What is the ratio of students who applied for SSC CGL in 2013, 2015 and 2016 together to the students who applied for IBPS PO in 2012, 2013 and 2017 together.
options: 35 : 41
27 : 20
22 : 34
51 : 32
43 : 53

quiz.text: If in year 2014, 20% of students who applied for IBPS PO also applied for SSC CGL then the number of students who apply only for SSC-CGL are what percent of number of students who apply only for IBPS PO in year 2014.

If number of students who apply for SSC CGL in 2011 are  less than students who apply for SSC CGL in 2012 then, number of students who apply for SSC CGL in 2011 are what percent of number of students who apply for IBPS PO in 2015.
options: 30%
25%
35%
40%
50%

quiz.text: What is the difference between average of students who apply for SSC-CGL over all years and average of students who apply for IBPS-PO over all years. (approximately)
options: 3.5 Lakh
4 Lakh
3 Lakh
2.5 Lakh
2 Lakh

quiz.text: If 45% of students who apply for SSC-SGL in 2015 are girls and ratio of girls who applied for SSC CGL in 2015 to the girls who applied for IBPS PO in 2017 is 4 : 5 then find the number of boys who applied for IBPS PO in 2017.
options: 8L
7L
9.5L
4L
3.75L
